<<<api>>>: foreach loop
<<<code>>>: for(Character[] charArr : charSets){
  if(doesWordMatch){
    //dosomething
  } else {
    break;
  }
}
<<<explanation>>>: In a foreach loop, you cannot add additional parameters like "doesWordMatch == true" directly to the loop. You will need to use an if statement inside the loop to check the condition and then perform the desired action.

<<<api>>>: foreach loop
<<<code>>>: for(Character[] charArr : charSets){
  if(doesWordMatch){
    //dosomething
  } else {
    break;
  }
}
<<<explanation>>>: In a foreach loop, you cannot directly add additional parameters to the loop condition. You can only iterate over the elements of the collection. If you want to add additional conditions, you can do it within the loop body using if statements or other control flow statements.

}
<<<explanation>>>: In a foreach loop, you cannot add additional conditions directly to the loop itself. You will need to use an if statement inside the loop to check for the additional condition and break out of the loop if necessary.

}

<<<api>>>: foreach loop
<<<code>>>: for(Character[] charArr : charSets){
  if(doesWordMatch){
    //dosomething
  } else {
    break;
  }
}
<<<explanation>>>: In a foreach loop, you cannot add additional conditions directly to the loop statement. However, you can add conditional statements inside the loop to achieve the desired behavior. In the given code, the condition "doesWordMatch" is checked inside the loop, and if it is true, the code inside the "if" block will be executed. If it is false, the loop will be terminated using the "break" statement.

<<<api>>>: foreach loop
<<<code>>>: for(Character[] charArr : charSets){
  if(doesWordMatch){
    // do something
  } else {
    break;
  }
}
<<<explanation>>>: In a foreach loop, you cannot add additional parameters to the loop itself. However, you can add conditions within the loop to achieve the desired behavior. In this case, you can use an if-else statement to check if the condition doesWordMatch is true, and perform the desired action. If the condition is false, you can use the break statement to exit the loop.
